questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a group named Group1.

You create a Conditional Access policy named CAPolicy1 and assign CAPolicy1 to Group1.

You need to configure CAPolicy1 to require the members of Group1 to reauthenticate every eight hours when they connect to Microsoft Exchange Online.

What should you configure?

discussion.content: Correct

Selected Answer: A
in endpoint admin center go Security > Conditional Access > create CA policy, choose the platform you want to apply the policy > Under Access controls > Session.
 Select Sign-in frequency.
 Choose Periodic reauthentication and enter a value of hours or days or select Every time.

reference :
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-session-lifetime

Answer is correct

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-session-lifetime

choices.C: an assignment that uses a Sign-in risk condition
choices.B: an assignment that uses a User risk condition

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

Users have iOS devices that are not enrolled in Microsoft Endpoint Manager.

You create an app protection policy for the Microsoft Outlook app as shown in the exhibit. (Click the Exhibit tab.)

//IMG//


You need to configure the policy to meet the following requirements:

• Prevent the users from using the Outlook app if the operating system version is less than 12.0.0.
• Require the users to use an alphanumeric passcode to access the Outlook app.

What should you configure in an app protection policy for each requirement? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
same question as the previous page but with a different albeit a modern view of the app protection policy screenshot.
answers are correct.

answers look correct - Conditional launch to set the min version 
https://nathanblasac.com/intune-application-protection-policy-mam-conditional-launch-block-non-compliant-version-of-ios-1e5853f3c20a

Access requirements to set the passcode 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-protection-policy-settings-ios

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains the groups shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You create a Conditional Access policy named CAPolicy1 that will block access to Microsoft Exchange Online from iOS devices. You assign CAPolicy1 to Group1.

You discover that User1 can still connect to Exchange Online from an iOS device.

You need to ensure that CAPolicy1 is enforced.

What should you do?

discussion.content: C is correct

Selected Answer: B
The policy will work better if it is assigned to all devices. This will make sure the policy works for registered and unregistered devices. I think will do for the options available.

D is the correct answer for me.

Under Cloud apps or actions > Include, select All cloud apps.
Under Conditions, select Device platforms

 Set Configure to Yes.
 Under Include, select Any device
 Under Exclude, select Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS.
 Select, Done.

Under Access controls > Grant, select Block access, then select Select.
Confirm your settings and set Enable policy to Report-only.
Select Create to create to enable your policy.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-policy-unknown-unsupported-device
Policy is already assigned to group1 and it should work as is. But because it's not working then the policy is probably not enabled. Answer C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. Default the policy is created in report-mode

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nSoAnFhDm9s go to time 1:40

Selected Answer: B
Answer seems correct. The question states that CAPolicy1 is already configured to block iOS devices, so it needs to be assigned to a group of devices for it to take affect. The filter would be needed if the policy didn't already have it configured.

Selected Answer: D
I am under the impression that the proper implementation of such a policy means that the Assignment is for the Users and the next thing would be to set a Condition with "Filter for devices". At that point you include the group of devices you want.

Thats why i am leaning towards D.

comments.content: In fact, the conditions can select Device platforms to iOS. If you choice Filter for device,there is no platform to choice.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
from what i learned going through materials is assign policy to group containing devices doesn't make scenes to me because the CA policy is applied on user identity so policy being assigned to group of users is correct, however when creating such policy by default it is not on or enabled, its in Report-only mode or "silent". it has to be on for policy to take effect.

appreciate any one's feedback on this.

comments.content: also the key word in the question here is "You need to ensure that CAPolicy1 is enforced."
Alternatively Filter for devices could be right but there isn't enough information on what was actually applied in CA Policy1.

I would say Enable should be correct. Once a CA policy is created it's not automatically enabled for obvious reasons that you don't lock yourself out inadvertently.
See this: https://danielchronlund.com/2018/11/23/how-multiple-conditional-access-policies-are-applied/
And this screen here:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-policies

discussion.content: this seems correct to me.

choices.A: Configure a new terms of use (TOU).
choices.D: Add a condition in CAPolicy1 to filter for devices.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains a computer named Computer1 that runs Windows 8.1.

Computer1 has apps that are compatible with Windows 10.

You need to perform a Windows 10 in-place upgrade on Computer1.

Solution: You copy the Windows 10 installation media to a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) deployment share. You create a task sequence, and then you run the MDT deployment wizard on Computer1.

Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Yes
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/deploy-windows-mdt/upgrade-to-windows-10-with-the-microsoft-deployment-toolkit

A is Correct. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/deploy-windows-mdt/upgrade-to-windows-10-with-the-microsoft-deployment-toolkit

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer as MDT is the only way to deploy win10 with an in place upgrade, besides locally through the OS, or via a network share through the OS again. It doesnt matter if it doesnt state the exact Task Sequence to be used, but the fact that it can be done Via MDT.

Selected Answer: B
Technically you can use MDT to do in-place upgrade.this really depends on what kind of task sequence template is chosen, its too broad to say just create task sequence; if you choose the standard task sequence it will just wipe the machine and install windows10, for this to be correct you need to choose a "Template: Standard Client Upgrade Task Sequence" to do an in-place upgrade.
so for me the answer is no.
this is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A is Correct.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/admincenter/overview
A for sure

Selected Answer: A
Yes. A would be the correct answer. Follow Jester's thread to see why.

comments.content: Verified in my tenant, Microsoft 365 Apps admin center (URL https://config.office.com/officeSettings/configure), do your customizations, download XML.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A? you can create O356 config XML files in browser 

https://config.office.com/

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and 100 computers that run Windows 10.

You need to deploy Microsoft Office Professional Plus 2019 to the computers by using Microsoft Office Deployment Tool (ODT).

What should you use to create a customization file for ODT?

choices.B: the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center
